content: Mayor’s Remarks:1. City Council meetings will begin on September 24. All bureaus should handle the cases raised by council members as soon as possible.2. September is usually the low season for Tainan’s tourism. Bureaus and departments should think of more campaigns to promote the city. Starting from October, several large-scale activities will be held; concerned bureaus should be well prepared in advance.Announcements1. The Cultural Affairs Bureau, Economic Development Bureau, and Bureau of Transportation’s report on 2020 National Day fireworks display. (refer to written sources for details)Decision: Approved for reference filingMayor’s Remarks:(1) All bureaus should put full efforts to carry out 2020 National Day fireworks display. Concerned bureaus should carefully plan the arrangement of programs, stands, and traffic. Attention should be put especially on the traffic flow of VIPs. We should do our best to ensure that our citizens have a joyful Double Tenth long holiday.(2) Regarding the quantity of stands, 480 is the currently planned number, but it may be increased in the future. 5% of the stands will be “charity stands”, meaning that no rental fee, but only cleaning fee will be charged. The Police Department should conduct extra patrol in the parking lot, areas with high density of people, and around the stands to prevent incidents of theft, conflicts, and gang fights.(3) The Economic Development Bureau may request vendors to prepare their own garbage cans. This will reduce littering, lower the workload of cleaners, and help maintain a clean environment.
